revised_title: Lunar Influence on Magnetic Direction at Toronto, St. Helena, and Hobarton
tldr: Colonel Edward Sabine examines the influence of the moon on magnetic direction at Toronto, St. Helena, and Hobarton. He analyzes six years of hourly observations at Toronto, five years at St. Helena, and five years at Hobarton, finding a lunar diurnal variation in the magnetic declination at each station. The results show that the extreme elongations of the magnetic direction have different values and occur at different times at each station, suggesting a disparity in the lunar influence on the magnetic direction.
